oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Little David Riveter and holder on driving 5/8 hot rivets on bulkhead of coal barge at Nashville Bridge Co., Nashville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Transforming the Economy
Infrastructure
Construction workers; Metallurgical industry; Riveting; African Americans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Founded by Arthur J. Dyer, the Nashville Bridge Company was Tennessee's most productive bridge building firm in the early twentieth century.
